verses.t: I will praise{H3034} thee, LordO {H3068}, with my whole heart{H3820}; I will shew forth{H5608} all thy marvellous works{H6381}.
I will be glad{H8055} and rejoice{H5970} in thee: I will sing praise{H2167} to thy name{H8034}, O thou most High{H5945}.
When mine enemies{H341} are turned{H7725} back{H268}, they shall fall{H3782} and perish{H6} at thy presence{H6440}.

For thou hast maintained{H6213} my right{H4941} and my cause{H1779}; thou satest{H3427} in the throne{H3678} judging{H8199} right{H6664}.maintained…: Heb. made my judgmentjudging right: Heb. judging in righteousness
Thou hast rebuked{H1605} the heathen{H1471}, thou hast destroyed{H6} the wicked{H7563}, thou hast put out{H4229} their name{H8034} for ever{H5769} and ever{H5703}.

O thou enemy{H341}, destructions{H2723} are come to a perpetual{H5331} end{H8552}: and thou hast destroyed{H5428} cities{H5892}; their memorial{H2143} is perished{H6} with them{H1992}.O thou…: or, The destructions of the enemy are come to a perpetual end: and their cities hast thou destroyed, etc
LordBut the {H3068} shall endure{H3427} for ever{H5769}: he hath prepared{H3559} his throne{H3678} for judgment{H4941}.
And he shall judge{H8199} the world{H8398} in righteousness{H6664}, he shall minister judgment{H1777} to the people{H3816} in uprightness{H4339}.
LordThe {H3068} also will be a refuge{H4869} for the oppressed{H1790}, a refuge{H4869} in times{H6256} of trouble{H6869}.a refuge: Heb. an high place
And they that know{H3045} thy name{H8034} will put their trust{H982} Lordin thee: for thou, {H3068}, hast not forsaken{H5800} them that seek{H1875} thee.
Sing praises{H2167} Lordto the {H3068}, which dwelleth{H3427} in Zion{H6726}: declare{H5046} among the people{H5971} his doings{H5949}.
When he maketh inquisition{H1875} for blood{H1818}, he remembereth{H2142} them: he forgetteth{H7911} not the cry{H6818} of the humble{H6041}.humble: or, afflicted
Have mercy{H2603} Lordupon me, O {H3068}; consider{H7200} my trouble{H6040} which I suffer of them that hate{H8130} me, thou that liftest me up{H7311} from the gates{H8179} of death{H4194}:
That I may shew forth{H5608} all thy praise{H8416} in the gates{H8179} of the daughter{H1323} of Zion{H6726}: I will rejoice{H1523} in thy salvation{H3444}.
The heathen{H1471} are sunk down{H2883} in the pit{H7845} that they made{H6213}: in the net{H7568} which{H2098} they hid{H2934} is their own foot{H7272} taken{H3920}.

LordThe {H3068} is known{H3045} by the judgment{H4941} which he executeth{H6213}: the wicked{H7563} is snared{H5367} in the work{H6467} of his own hands{H3709}. Higgaion{H1902}. Selah{H5542}.Higgaion: that is, Meditation
The wicked{H7563} shall be turned{H7725} into hell{H7585}, and all the nations{H1471} that forget{H7913} God{H430}.
For the needy{H34} shall not alway{H5331} be forgotten{H7911}: the expectation{H8615} of the poor{H6035} shall not perish{H6} for ever{H5703}.
Arise{H6965}, LordO {H3068}; let not man{H582} prevail{H5810}: let the heathen{H1471} be judged{H8199} in thy sight{H6440}.
Put{H7896} them in fear{H4172}, LordO {H3068}: that the nations{H1471} may know{H3045} themselves to be but men{H582}. Selah{H5542}.
